Package org.fest.reflect.method

Provides a Fluent Interface for method invocation via the Reflection API.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Invoker<T> Understands the use of reflection to access a method from an object.
Name Understands the name of a method to invoke using Java Reflection.
ParameterTypes<T> Understands the parameter types of the method to invoke.
ReturnType<T> Understands the return type of the method to invoke.
 

Package org.fest.reflect.method Description

Provides a Fluent Interface for method invocation via the Reflection API.

Note: Classes in this package are not intended to be used directly. To use them, you need to use the class org.fest.reflect.Reflection.

Here are some examples: 

   // import static org.fest.reflect.Reflection.*;

   // Equivalent to call 'person.setName("Luke")'
   method("setName").withParameterTypes(String.class)
                    .in(person)
                    .invoke("Luke");
 
   // Equivalent to call 'person.concentrate()'
   method("concentrate").in(person).invoke();
   
   // Equivalent to call 'person.getName()'
   String name = method("getName").withReturnType(String.class)
                                  .in(person)
                                  .invoke();
